title: No offence but what was riot thinking when they made Rek'sai?
body:
How to play Rek'sai : Just W then pop up Q then pentakill.....Rek'sai does so much damage to the point where she can 1V1 anyone at 1/10th hp.....What the heck?
Why don't you remove her from game because even a nerf can't fix that

replies.body: Was the Rek'Sai fed? You have to remember that any champion can be deemed OP when he or she are fed. In addition, considering she is a new champion, very few players know how to play her and how to counter play her bar the few that already used her during PBE. Every champion has its advantages and its disadvantages. Look for Rek'Sai's disadvantages.

why do people always seem to cry op with new champs, the last 2-3 of them have been buffed the following patch
its been commented before you just need to let the community get use to her and then see how well she does in a competitive environment.

Kalista hasn't had changes afaik, Azir is incredibly strong, he's just really buggy, Gnar got buffed because people couldn't see how strong he was/his play style was a bit different. He was nerfed a patch or two after.
yeah buts thats the thing they wherent op from release they where, in the grand scheme of things considerably balanced
i understand what your saying its just i feel thats it more so the unfamiliarity of new champs into that game that makes them seem op where in reality their damage and stats are "balanced"

>
> How to play Rek'sai : Just W then pop up Q then pentakill.....Rek'sai does so much damage to the point where she can 1V1 anyone at 1/10th hp.....What the heck?
> Why don't you remove her from game because even a nerf can't fix that

She's not that strong.

Remember to destroy tunnels when you see one, wards too I can't stress how many times I see people walking pass an enemy pink ward or an enemy green ward right next to an ally pink one without giving it a second thought.

Do that, Rek'Sai isn't that much of a threat unless ofc you have no idea what you should be doing.

I've been playing her a fair bit, while yes her numbers need some tweaks, I find her to be a little underwhelming in some aspects.

Particularly with her tunnels being so easy to destroy, it feels way too easy to destroy her tunnels this is coming from perspective of playing as her and against her.
I think that the best thing to do would be to increase the time it takes to stand on one and collapse it, which would create a healthy point of counter play in that you must decide if it's worth standing on this thing for 5-10 seconds or should I be helping my team.

I've been in several matches so far where there are moments where either the enemy jungler or support decides to roam through both jungles stepping on tunnels, despite the fact that I could turn up at any of them at any given time.
